I was about to get a 1k hummingbird... Glad that I got this first 10 bucks vs. 1000 Get this app
It doesn't do anything that it says it does. There is no lake depths on the maps. I wish I had my 10 back
Used in Galveston at st. Luis pass and chocolate bay, very hard to navigate some of the shallow waters, this app was spot on, and actually help us out more the my buddies 700 lowrance

What I really got it for is to track and save routes, that I take with different fishing buddies and I can say that it was worth every cent.  You really don't need gps on your boat of you have this app.  But, it's nice to have both and this one is portable and you can even save routes that a guide took you on , with out him even knowing.  Tracking routes in shallow water is very important, bc when you try to go back to a spot someone else took you, you will find out they know those waters well and make it look easy.  This is where this app comes most handy for me.

US map only has half the Great Lakes including Detroit River.  No more apparent detail than previous versions and Internet is required to download details.  No upgrade path and customer service is useless.  Old version is better but not great either.  Leaves me wishing they could get this right  maybe Lakemap can get something together.  An ipadiphone dual version would be nice since I would hate to pay twice for a bad app.  Support for older maps is horrible and upgrade offers little reward.
App is terrible it will not download any maps.  Have tried everything and there is no tech support to contact.   Just spend the money on the lake master chip
Not useful without GoTo waypoint with DTW, STW, VMG etc. The only one I found with that info is MotionX GPS

They lake that I am fishing in is not even charted on the map  It seems like that if you have a pretty small lake in general they will not be mapped. Don't waste your money of you live on a small lake, like me
the download provided nothing helpful, all it did was to suggest I buy a chart for 90, and inferred that I might need several charts. 10 wasted
Very helpful out on the water, better if you have a lifeproof case so you don't have to worry about getting your phone wet.
Really wish you could get water temps too that would be great

I started using this when they were selling separate apps for lakes  costal waters, this one combines them. These are vector charts, different from the NOAA o line charts, but this is more effective for use on electronic devices.  Works nicely on the iPhonewould love to see an upgrade for iPad and retina support.

Don't listen to the negative reviews. Works perfectly for the lakes that I fish Barkley and Kentucky. Shows creek channel and contours well and has a variety of other details such as submerged structure, buoys, and more. Worth 10 dollars easy.
Works very poor in my IPad.  Compared to the chart plotter system on my boat which is Rose Point, this is a dud program. Disappointing

You have to register an account with Navionics to make changes or add favorites to you maps, but you never receive the confirmation email from Navionics to complete the process.  If it isn't fixed, then it's 10 bucks in the lake.

I am a fisherman for inland lakes.   This is a gem of an app.  It has a high level of functionality and is as handy as your iPhone.  I find it very useful.  I use it a lot when fishing with friends in their boats.  I can mark a spot and transfer it later to my boat's GPS.  I have also used it, with the guide's permission, to record waypoints when on a guided trip.   It also works excellent when navigating to waypoints.  It gives you a current heading while under way and I have found it to be very accurate, both in recording waypoints and also finding spots.   I also feel secure having a backup to my main navigation GPS when on my boat that is potent enough to get'r done if I were to need it for something critical like finding your way out of some of the jungles in Texas lakes.   This is a HIGH value app at 10.
Works amazing best app there is for fishing and ice fishing wouldnt  have anything else
Best money ever spent use this for ice fishing all the time.

I don't have enough money for expensive hummingbird gpsdown imaging fish finder. Navonics chip over 100 by itself. This will work for now. Still use maps because the batteries don't die on them. But I don't think this was made to replace good ole maps. Just another tool to play with while trying to jaw jack the big one.

I bought this app last spring and used it for fishing on 5 or 6 lakes in N Texas.  This is a great app for the price. I used it more prior to fishing to mark spots etc.. Once on the lake, It took me right to the spot I picked out and I could also mark a spot for future reference. The only real problem I had was if you mark say a good Crappie hole on the map, everybody who has this app now knows exactly where ur spot is.  For the price, not a bad app. Use it w a depth  fish finder and it will guide u to ur location.
This is based off the less than great iPhone gps so it will be off a little but it has so many lakes and waterways in it. I use it all the time Great app

I should have read the reviews.  If I used this as planned I would hit rocks that appear on the sd version of the product.  The sd chip slides into my garmin and is wonderful.  The NOAA charts have more details then this.   Waiting for refund

I purchased this last year and used it a few time.  App was great. Found some unmarked underwater structure that wasn't showing on another product.  Since they have come out with a couple of updates.  Well I just opened the app for ice fishing only to see they took off virtually all the contour lines.  For 10 maybe this is what the app should have been, but this app now is NOT what I paid for.  I will not buy anything from navionics again because of what they did with the customers.  At the very least they should have left the app alone for all that had previously purchased it.
Absolutely love this app. Well made and easy to use. I would recommend to any boating enthusiast.

After reading all of the positive reviews, I was excited about this app.  We thought it would be a more affordable option than buying a heart monitor in retail and we wanted to be able to checkin on the baby throughout the pregnancy because we had complications in the past.  Unfortunately, I never once could hear my little ones' heartbeat which was shocking considering we never had issues finding or holding onto a heartbeat in the doctors office. I tried the developer's suggestions to find a quiet room and I also tried to listen at multiple times throughout the day and it never worked.  Even at 39 weeks, I never heard a heartbeat regardless of where I positioned it.  In fact, I had a hard time even capturing my own heartbeat . I gave it two stars because it is easy to use good navigation and userfriendly and offers some good features but since I wasn't able to ever hear a heart beat it was a waste of money.  Since everyone's pregnancy is different, it could just be that I wasn't a good candidate for this type of thing...maybe it would work better for others

I was skeptical but as an extremely excited dad i felt this app would be an extra  connection to my baby for me if it worked. We tried early on at week 8 and couldnt get anything. We tried again every few weeks. After week 24 we kind of gave up until week 32. It didnt take 20 seconds and could hear it loud and clear. It was music to my ears. I give the app 5 stars bc it does everything it claims to do. It also says that you get the best results between week 3040, which was true in my case. So i say the app is worth the money cheaper than doplar, but wait till at least week 25 to try.

I have had this app downloaded since I was maybe 15 weeks pregnant. Since my placenta is in the back of my uterus, I have had no issues feeling my sweet baby boy move since 15 weeks or hearing his sweet little heart beat with this since 23 weeks. I am now 30 weeks and I can find his heart beat every day with this. Its very good and Im happy this is free because I didnt want to spend 60 on a doppler. I totally recommend this app to any pregnant woman who wants to hear their sweet bub. I would suggest waiting until around 25 weeks to make sure you can actually can pick up the heart beat, but dont be discouraged if you dont at that point. The app suggests you wait until youre between 30 and 40 weeks and I have had no difficulty finding his heart beat now that I am 30 weeks. Earlier it was a little bit difficult. Make sure you use airplane mode when youre looking for the heart beat though and that youre in a quiet room.

I switched from Spotify, since I'm planning on getting an echo down the road. It's a very nice app and easy to use, but there's a few things I think would make the app better, some of these might be here, I just haven't found it yet.
I don't see a radio feature, to play based on generas. It would be nice to have this, in addition to playing stations based on a particular song or even a users playlist (like Spotify has)
It would be nice to be able to organize songs in a playlist by artist, song, or recently added ,being able to do this in ascending or descending order.

It would also be nice if we didn't have to re-download a playlist each time we added a song, but just make a playlist offline, then whenever we add a song to that playlist, it would automatically be downloaded.

I can see that if a song is downloaded, it will show it to the right, but it would be nice if we pressed add song to a particular playlist by mistake to a song that was already in that playlist, it would warm us. Like wise if we add a few song from an album, later wanting to add the whole album, by the button to do so quickly, it would once again warn us, then having the option to only add the songs that weren't in that playlist.

Finally, it would be nice if the song cover (that screen that pops up when a song is tapped) wouldn't automatically pop up. Instead you have to swipe up on that circle on the bottom, like we can do now. This way, it might be a bit faster to find/change songs, and plain navigate faster.
This is a nice app, and I think these are some things that might make it even better.
P.s. even though I rarely use it, I love the lyrics feature. ?
Amazon, please work out your feelings with Google and then add Chromecast support.
After trying several music streaming services I feel like my expectations are a bit higher than they once were. The app is slow and lags too much. It's very annoying and I don't like it.

In my opinion the UI is rather user friendly and I can only think of a couple minor improvements which are necessary. For a low price you gain access to a wide array of music when subscribing to Unlimited. I would say about 80-85% of the songs I've searched have been available. The two components which I believe Amazon failed to deliver on is the music category selections and the stations which are expected to play music from similar artist or those which match your preferences.
Pandora is far beyond Amazon Music in their apps ability to recognize music preferences. If Amazon can improve these components I would likely use the app exclusively when listening to music.
I don't care much for this app but it would be better if they didn't bother you so often about rating them.  So one star is about all I can give this app.

I got rid of my Spotify subscription to get this service, which I am thoroughly enjoying. I find it very intuitive and user friendly. My only complaint, and it's a pretty big one for me, is that the app resets itself way too quickly. I'll be listening to a song I really like, usually one I just discovered in a random playlist, then I'll get a 30 second phone call, and when I go back to listening it sets me back on the main page without giving me the option to continue listening to the song. Very irritating, almost enough to make me go back to Spotify. If any Amazon customer service people are reading these reviews, please consider fixing this!

The app is okay overall, but since the few updates I've noticed that certain albums that I removed from the recently played list keep showing up in the same list after closing the app and opening it again later.
It's really annoying because it's an eye sore and takes up unnecessary slots that I would prefer to have reserved for music I like. It didn't start behaving like this until about two months ago.
I'm seriously considering switching to another service just because the application is so slow...

Adding to the frustration is that sometimes when I'm trying to remove the song, the app registers my finger tap as if I wanted to play it again. Very irritating. I don't like this app as much as I used to, especially as a paying Prime Unlimited Music member.

I'm blind and depend on VoiceOver to interact with my device; and hence, the Amazon Music app. Accessibility support is shaky; meaning that the VoiceOver cursor jumps around a lot. I have to keep scrolling back to find my last position on the screen after performing any action - such as downloading a song, adding to a playlist, Etc. This is not an issue with iOS or VoiceOver, because this behavior only occurs within Amazon's apps; from Prime to Music.
Please enhance VoiceOver support. I'd be happy to raise my rating once this is addressed.
Otherwise, for jamming to music, I do enjoy the selection and compatibility with my Echo Dot!
My only other request is to please add a fading option. I'd like a song to gradually lead into the next without silence between.

I wrote to this company, and I requested if there was anyway I could purchase the power pack with the money I used to purchase two apps I just purchased. Other than the fact it didn't crash during use, Microsoft's approach to providing photos functionality is, well, what I expected. They just don't get it. Please guys, we get the fact you can't do any of this rubbish you cram down our throat -- STOP.

MS is your typical date order sort. Like Google and Apple. And like exactly what people are complaining about all over the web. Either we don't understand we're stupid or the big boys can't no longer provide functionality they could provide over 20 years ago.

Photo's are dumped into one big pile, all names changed to nothing you will recognize but, in date order. So if you're trying to compile a few albums, good luck even finding a few of the pics you want. There's no uploading to a specific album. It's dump them in the pile and then compile an album. I must really be stupid, this isn't the way I'd approach this functionality. Nor would Adobe. Who, last I heard, has some experience with photography. Nor did Apple until Steve departed. I guess he was just as dumb as we are -- in the eyes of Apple, Google and MS.

My journey was to replace Apple Photo's with a product that allowed albums to be sorted by something other than the last pic moved into an album. Tried Google, it's even more limited. Tried MS, it's very poorly executed by people who know nothing about photography or the simple execution steps needed to compile some on-line photo albums. And have no inclination to ask someone who does. All these folks are following what Yahoo! did for years as it destroyed its business. Grab your popcorn now.

There is very little flexibility in organizing and viewing photo albums and no way to tell what photos have been put in an album and which ones still remain uncategorized into an album.  I would love to be able to sort photos not in an album from those that are so I can easily chip away at organizing them.

I pay nothing for my DropBox and Google Drive accounts, but I DO have the Files integration with both of those services.

This app does most of what I want it to do with Onedrive for business, but I also use Sharepoint, and I can indeed access Sharepoint files from the app. Unfortunately, I cannot figure out how to upload images and videos to the Sharepoint site from my iPhone. When I select the image, the onedrive icon comes up, but when I click it, the only option is to save the file to the regular onedrive for business location, and not to the Sharepoint site. I end up having to save it to onedrive for business folder first, and then later going on and manually moving the files over to Sharepoint. If there is a solution to this, I'll gladly change my star rating.
Suddenly app does show all my files.  Only OneDrive accessed through full website version show all files.  Very aggravating.  I need to be mobile and have access to client files.
Still no explanation forthcoming from MS regarding the ability of a recipient of a shared folder to browse to the root folder and all its subfolders with no such permissions granted to anyone.
August 2017 - the OneDrive app still proves to be a 1 star app.  The continual updates prove to do as much harm as good.  Finally got it connected again. Dreadfully slow uploads.
After recent update, I just can't upload anything from safari. When I tap on the upload to OneDrive button, the app will crash anyway. It is really annoying.

I love that OneDrive is finally starting to be natively integrated into more things. Unfortunately, it's lagging way behind in its integration with iOS 11's Files app. All my other apps has made it look like a native file system a long time ago.
Latest versions crash like crazy on the 10.5 iPad Pro when zooming around in the map.  Almost unusable at this point.

This is one of the most user unfriendly apps that I've used in a long time. It simply does not work. I put in a price range and my other filters and search...and nothing happens. Awful, awful, awful!

I enjoy using this app regular way in fact every single day as I am shopping for a house. The only issue I have is that the sap put you in touch with many homes for sale in the real estate market but does not always provide certain vital information, such as TAXES, lot size, school districts (only nearby schools- not always the correct school district), square footage, history... all this information is input by the listing agent, but this Realtor.com app should not allow this information to be absent when a listing is made. MISSING INFO or blank fields must be completed. In my opinion, in  the NY market you can't responsibly shop for a home without knowing the most accurate TAXES sometimes 3-3.25% of price and as I have already been denied a mortgage because taxes were $14,600 on a $519,000 home and I didn't know (the correct taxes). Moral of the story is this app won't replace a Realtor by any means. But it will allow you just the level of involvement a buyer should have.

Mortgage calculator doesn't give full freedom of entering all the numbers: closing costs are still a mystery (no Good faith statements) and the interest rates are very different EVERYDAY- so don't put too much comfort in those days.

Nearby schools often is nearest but not the SCHOOLs within the DISTRICT, which on Long Island is VERY COMMON, that the nearest school may be Smithtown but the School District is COMMACK where the taxes are significantly higher. So a simple School District name or # is an EASY FIX. As for taxes very often if not ALWAYS the taxes are 2007-2010 with increased or decreased %, but rarely is it the actual (last year's) taxes. Which anyone can say $10,000a year might be  acceptable but $15,000 is a DEAL BREAKER. Simple intergrading the county clerk tax data (not just website) would make a huge difference. Lastly the mortgage calculator should by this point is the Realtor/ Buyers responsibility to know what the numbers are except the bank will NEVER QUOTE a percentage rate with the ever changing rates so the calculator is a good tool to remind the buyers of the differences in cost with rate fluctuations...

Love this app, but had to switch to Zillow because the crashing has increased too much to deal with. It crashes at least 10+ times in a 30 minute session. I've tried restarting the app and even my phone multiple times to no avail. I give up...

This app is generally good at relaying MLS information and updating frequently. But... lately I've noticed issues with notifications?which is the biggest perk of using this app in a competitive market. My iPhone notifications will say that Realtor.com has 5 new listings that match my search. When I open the app, I will see one new listing plus one or two that I've already viewed. And the text is usually overlapping itself on each listing, making it hard to see. I have tried updating my iOS, updating the app, and even deleting and reinstalling it. Still not working properly and it's been several weeks. I'd still recommend it for researching properties but the notifications feature needs some help.

Love the app. Like stated in the title, I think the school ratings should go back to red yellow and green. Grading the different schools by different shades of green is everyone gets a trophy mentality.  If the school is rated poor in the state then it should be put on blast so homebuyers who use your app can make an informed decision. I for one look at school system first and foremost (I have three kids starting school within the next few years), and the different shades of green can be misleading if not expected. For example, there is a search I have saved on the app that encompasses a great public school district and a horrible one. My friend bought a house in the horrible school district unknowingly. (Fortunately for him the school system is considered to be failing by the state and he receives free tuition and transport to a private school across town.) I'm not saying that he bought a house in a horrible school district because of the app (he should have done his research) but it could have been more easily red flagged.

It is ok I like the idea of transferring steps to gifts, but an issue I had is that not all steps are counted. Apparently, they have to be outdoor steps, and there is a 5% commission fee, which was frustrating to me because I'm not a big runner so half of my steps don't even go to getting sweat coins. Another issue I had was the things you could get for sweat coins. The issue was that all the stuff was super expensive and hard to get and there are also not a lot of things to choose from. I didn't give it 1 star because I like the idea and if you are a big runner this might be a good app for you, it was just disappointing to me.

My first complaint is the sweatcoin currency symbol. In the app, the symbol is very easy to mistake for a dollar sign. The person who invited me thought she was making $5.00 a day, but after I got the app and noticed their sneaky symbol trick, I did the math and found that it came out to under $0.07 per day for 5000 steps. The Amazon gift card is $50 and costs 3650 sweatcoin currency, which will take exactly 2 years (exactly 730 days, an unlikely coincidence) to get.

Get rid of sweatcoin currency. Just tell users exactly how much their getting in real dollars. Alternatively, keep the currency (but change the symbol, anything but an S) but always show the real money conversion next to any value of sweatcoin currency. (Basically, don't be misleading)
Count all steps a person takes, not just steps they take outdoors. (Just seems like an obvious change to me, a step is a step)
Not worth the time it took to download. This app is a drain on your battery and you will never see any rewards.

This app pays you for walking. You can make a max of $10 SCD (sweatcoin dollar) a day. Assuming you reach the $10 SCD limit everyday, it would take 2 and a half years for you to be able to purchase the $50 paypal. It would take 5 years of reaching this limit everyday to get the $1,000 paypal. With a stricter algorithm and better step verification there would be no need for a SCD daily limit. Without the SCD limit, this app would actually pay out for those who walk a lot and not pay out for those who don't. 2 years for $50 USD is absolutely outrageous.

Ran 10,000 steps, but was only credited 85 steps! That's less than 1% of what I did. UPDATE: Ran 8,200 steps. Credited with 2,000. That's 25% of what I did. Not getting credit, 5% fee, and membership fees make this app not worthwhile.

Also, 1,000 steps equals 1 coin. Then they take 5% as fee for no reason. You need 100-1,000 coins to do get anything worthwhile. Also, you are capped on how much you can earn. If you want to earn more, you'll have to pay coins. (Other reviews incorrectly say you pay real money, not Sweatcoins, for these higher membership levels.)

The largest prizes are meant to be purchased in a group, you POOL your SWC to purchase it, we're in this for the long haul since it's free haha so it doesn't bother me. You also have to walk outside to get the maximum benefit!

This is a good app for being able to track the gosh darned MBTA in Boston (which we all fiercely detest), namely the green line. The second, and more important feature I wish for, is customizable alerts - specifically for individual B/C/D/E line updates...that, and for me to choose the times I receive alerts. I work retail and don't often ride during the PM rush hour, rather, just after. It's kinda not fun to have either rush hour, or everything always. Thanks.

The Apple Watch was fairly accurate (although I sometimes found that the transmission of info and use of location services by the Transit app would drain my phone battery), and it really saves the hassle of taking your phone out of your purse or pocket (sometimes in pouring rain) to determine when a bus was going to come. Are you planning on bringing it back in the future?

This app does a good job of listing all the transit options from one's location. However, it has a bad habit of predicting buses that never arrive. I have another bus app that is more accurate. Perhaps this app isn't as efficient with respect to dropping cancelled trips from its list. The ability to look at my watch and see what transit options are around and when they are arriving/departing was an invaluable feature. Only after reporting it would it be added and blocked, which is useless as what are the odds they'd use it twice? It's no better than blocking it manually.
This is all without even mentioning this company's very loose interpretation of their customers' privacy.

Update - I opened the app for the first time in a couple of days, and while fighting with a locked screen after waiting for then clicking the X to close the ad, I started thinking about this recent "destruction" of what was a great app.  So...a while back we got a notice that webcams would be removed (probably monetary decision) and I'm sure those webcam users pitched a fit.  I didn't care about the webcams. I just wanted a reliable weather app, not a view into thousands of people's backyards. Now with this last update the webcams are back, but they brought with them huge income generating ads and the option of locking into a monthly fee to make them go away... maybe time to find a weather app that remembers it's a weather app not a webcam host. I'll keep the app and watch for updates that hopefully get it back where it was, but I won't be using it again until that happens.

There's also the 50-50 chance that when I minimize the app or open up a different app it will either crash the app or log me out as well. I don't know why these issues exist, but it really gets frustrating. Pause and continue still remains an issue as well. If I pause a scene, minimize the app, return to the app (if it lets me), and attempt to resume playback, the app will display a heavily pixilzed image for upwards of 10 seconds. Sometimes it will display a still image of the video 15 seconds ahead of where the audio is playing. Then the image begins to play once the audio catches up. I'm not sure what this issue is, but I hope they address it soon.

Love how easy and fast it is to have OneDrive backup and sync all my important files, photos, videos, etc. I've moved away from Dropbox and Google Drive and now solely use OneDrive. Not only is it a better value for 1TB of storage at $70 but I recently upgraded to the $100 home plan. So now my entire family has their own 1TB of storage plus I have one account primarily for my business files backup. Plus the added bonus of getting the entire Microsoft Office Suite for 5 devices on top of the 5TB combined cloud storage is amazing! So the comparison of the $100 yearly plans; OneDrive gives you 5TB combined storage plus the Microsoft Office Suite on 5 devices, Google Drive gives you 2TB of storage and Dropbox gives you just 1TB of storage. So for me it was a no brainer. Microsoft has the most storage, best deal and the most features.

Almost missed sunrise on our latest trip to Cancun. Stated sunrise was at 7:44, but I new it was by 7:00. Actual time was 6:44. Great app, keep up the good work.

Love the detail provided with minimally intrusive ads. My one complaint is all too often I want to check the weather and it got a launch screen that says "Please try again later" and the app crashes. Are you doing maintenance that often, or does the app just fail intermittently? Easily my favorite weather app when it works!

Forces you to enable WiFi scanning and WiFi location FOR THE WHOLE PHONE, even if you are nowhere near WiFi. WiFi sucks battery for no reason while it scans even when WiFi is off. It's not needed, and they force you to turn it on anyway, killing your battery for no benefit. If you don't turn on the super battery drain WiFi mode, you can't get location for weather forecasts, even though the GPS mode works fine for the notifications, they won't let you use GPS fit location in the app. Retarded.

UDATE: 3 OCT 18....STILL BROKE!! I pay for this app, and I'm getting Sick and Tired of "Please try again later"....REALLY WU?Get...It...Together!! Are you trying to force us out of this app, like you did with 'Storm'??UPDATE: 9/03/18 STILL...getting the "Please try again later" message!! Also, AIR Quality feature doesn't work! We've had everything from hazardous, to moderate, smokey conditions and the Air Quality doesn't change!! 6/10/18 You've always been 5a-?...till latest update...I keep getting the "Please try again later" message, like several other people have mentioned...Please fix!!e??
Works for me. One of the big timer weather apps seriously slowed my phone down for some reason.

I used to use this all the time but when I installed on my new phone the app often won't start up and the widget won't connect at all. The app also won't find my location automatically anymore. I hope you fix this!

I used to love the app, recommended it to many friends as the best out there, recently in the last few months I've had issues about 50% of the time with it saying "try again later", I've tried phone restarts, internet restarts, switching to mobile data, etc with no luck ... Can anyone tell me what's going on with this? LG G6 and it used to work fine with my phone

Even with full signal and 4G it still crashes and I can only open the app once in a while. Mostly says "try again later" otherwise no issues with any features of the app was impressed but what's the point if you can't access it when you need it. :(
It tells me just what I need to know, in a convenient manner, without too many ad. I also like the localized forecasts.

App fails to load with nasty "try again later" if system wide language is not set to english, for example lithuanian. Setting english as system language solves problem but is not an option for non native english users. Other than that - quite useful app.

Used work flawlessly but in the past year it doesn't always load. Roughly 25% of the time. Not sure what happened to app. I tried deleting and reloading but problem still exists. Hopefully its fixed in the near future or I will go somewhere else.

Was a great weather app, lately get the "Try again later" message, especially during bad weather. More recently would often start up on its own, even if I'm using another app. And now I'm noticing a lot of battery drain. Guess it's time to uninstall this for good.
I like this weather app but do not understand why you say you have ski reports and it's been over a year that "the lift is broken but we are working on it". Jyst give up and worry about the forcasts.

Buggier than ever since recent update. App fails to find my location repeatedly or suggests trying again later without opening. Uninstall/reinstall with restart does not help. To be fair, when the app works it's great.

I like the app and I think it's just as accurate as the local news it any other app. My only problem with it is when I haven't used it in a while I'll try to open it I'll get an error message saying the app currently isn't working

Definitely the best weather app I've used. However there is a feature on the website that says 'temperature is about the same as yesterday' or " will be much warmer than yesterday' etc. This is the only weather service I've seen do this and this is exactly how humans react to temperatures ! It's why 60F in October is cool and in March it feels like its time for sandals. I've stopped using the app and just going to your website now. Please please add this to your app !!

Is it just me or are the reviews way too positive for how good this app really is? The service is really good but this app is so god damn slow. It takes at least 30 seconds to show my current location and weather. Besides that, the amount of information it gives in the Netherlands is really lacking. And top it off, the app crashes regularly when switching to it from another app. I really don't recommend this app.

Often tells me to "try again later" when I try to open the actual app. Widget won't update when this happens. I literally only use this app because the widget has a transparent option. If there was another app that looked good on my background, I'd use it instead.

Recent update, 10/2/2018, fixed absolutely nothing noted previously. My favorite current error, "Try again later", appears. Buggy garbage. Suggest you use another app. Original: Since Weather Channel came along, this app is horrible. Crashes when trying to enter settings, will not remain running, and most important, alerts no longer arrive. Should roll back to version prior to TWC acquisition. It worked great then.

I had no issues with this when I had it on my iPhone. Now that I have an android OS there appears to be a bug when trying to open the app. It sometimes says failed to open and says to retry. The app has to be closed before trying to open again. This wasn't an issue with iPhone.

This app still stinks, but now it's because of battery life. 15% of my battery (300mAh) used today is by this app with 1 minute of screen time. And it's only dinner time, more battery to get drained before the day is done by this horribly inefficient app.

I had been using Weather Bug but Weather Underground is far better. Better information, better radar, more flexible. ***Update ** I had to get a new phone and installed the app. It worked for a few weeks but now it will not even open. Very disappointed.

When it works, it's awesome, but lately, it just keeps erroring, with nothing but a pop-up saying "Please try again later." Sometimes it works and sometimes it doesn't. I wish it was more specific with the error, because it just seems random when it doesn't work.
Using Samsung Galaxy S7. Love the fearures and interface of this app but it crashes often..."server not available".

I really want to love this app. The weather is so accurate and goes into a lot of detail and presents it in a user-friendly way. I just wish they would get it together. For years, I've been trying to get this app to work, on many different devices, both apple and droid. It constantly crashes. Lately, every time i open it it says "please try again" and i have to shut down the app and reopen it. Or ill be using it, and it will suddenly crash. I am a patient person, but this has been going on literally for years.

Please Try Again Later That's the message I get about half of the time using this app now. I have the paid version. Like right now my app isn't working. I have to either reinstall or go elsewhere to get my forecast. Reinstalling fixes it temporarily. What happened to this awesome app? I put my phone in airplane mode at night and often other times. The apps will take a very long time to reopen properly. It gives the same message please try again later... The only reason I use it now is that I live in the mountains and it has a weather station that is more accurate. Every other app has one down the mountain in a town. This app is a frustrating disappointment. I cancel my subscription but still use it in addition to Weather Bug when this turd won't open. Geesh fix the damn thing you friggin losers!
Can't even open up this app anymore. IBM has ruined this company.

I am stuck with this app because it is the only one I know of that has a widget that allows me to see the three day forecast in a 1x4. It will never cease to boggle my mind why the standard for weather widgets is to only show current weather conditions. That's what windows are for. Anyway, my only gripe with this app is that roughly every fourth or fifth time I try to get a detailed forecast by tapping on the widget to open up the full app I get a message telling me to try again later. I was hoping it was a glitch that would be addressed in an update, but apparently not. LG V30, Verizon

App spontaneously moves to advertising not selected by users. Even if we must see advertising on app pages, we should NEVER be transferred to ad sites without intentional selection. Further, when multiple watches are in place, why does wundermap only show pop-up least severe?
